plugins.name: QuickCheck

plugins.name: figma-text-css
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you extract CSS styles from a selected text layer in Figma.

Get accurate font-weight, font-size, color, line-height, and letter-spacing instantly, formatted in pure CSS.


Perfect for developers and designers who want a fast way to turn styled text into usable web code.


üí° Features:

- Auto-generate CSS for font properties

- RGB to HEX color conversion

- Automatically cleans text by removing line breaks

- Works on selection change for a smooth workflow

plugins.name: Replacer
plugins.description:
You select the object / component in figma and run this plugin.

For color groups: It automatically scans for "groups" and will do it's best to replace it with color variables that share the same naming structure.

For color variables, or plain colors: You select the color / variable to be replaced (target) and select the color to replace it with (source).

Done.

‚òë Panel will remember what function you used last time.

‚òë Works with gradient stops, colors in text fields and drop/inner shadows.
plugins.tagline: Replaces colors based on their "group" or per link to a color variable.

plugins.name: Round Width to 8
plugins.description:
Make your designs cleaner and more consistent with this simple plugin that rounds the width of selected elements up to the next multiple of 8. Great for enforcing 8px spacing systems, aligning to design tokens, or preparing components for dev handoff.


Just select one or more resizable elements and run the plugin ‚Äî no UI, no fuss.
plugins.tagline: Rounds element widths up to the next multiple of 8 ‚Äî clean, consistent, and dev-ready.

plugins.name: frameToGroup
plugins.description:
frameToGroup converts frames into organised groups while retaining essential visual properties.


‚ú® Key Features

‚úÖ Effortless Conversion ‚Äì Convert frames into neatly structured groups while keeping fills, strokes, and effects intact.

‚úÖ Nested Frame Handling ‚Äì Automatically processes nested frames for a well-organised layer structure.

‚úÖ Style Preservation ‚Äì Retains local styles and effects using asynchronous processing.

‚úÖ User-Friendly UI ‚Äì Simple, intuitive interface with one-click conversion.

‚úÖ Continuous Workflow ‚Äì Keep the plugin open for multiple conversions without interruptions.


‚ú® How to Use

  1. Select the frames you wish to convert in your Figma document.
  2. Click "Convert Frames to Groups" in the plugin UI.
plugins.tagline: Convert Frames to Groups While Retaining Styles

plugins.name: ÊâìÂç∞Â∑•ÂÖ∑ Figma Print Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

Figma Print Pro is a specialized plugin that helps you create print-ready documents directly in Figma. Easily set up standard or custom page sizes, add bleed areas and crop marks, export high-quality PDFs in multiple color formats, and ensure professional results with built-in DPI checks.


Function Description

  1. Custom & Preset Dimensions: Choose from popular print sizes (A4, A3, B5) or enter exact dimensions.
  2. Bleed & Crop Marks: Add bleed lines and crop marks to prepare for professional trimming.
  3. Multi-page Documents: Generate multi-page print layouts all within a single Figma file.
  4. Color Management: Export PDFs in RGB, CMYK, or grayscale for precise color control.
  5. Adjustable Image Quality: Downsample images and set compression levels to optimize file size.
  6. DPI Checks: Analyze frames to confirm whether resolution meets professional print standards.


Usage

  1. Set Up a Document: In the plugin panel, pick a preset size (A4, A3, B5) or enter your custom width and height.
  2. Adjust Settings: Define bleed margins, enable crop marks, and specify the page count.
  3. Preview: The plugin generates a quick visual preview of each page.
  4. Export to PDF: Choose a color format (RGB, CMYK, or grayscale), select image quality settings, then export.
  5. Check DPI: Run the DPI check tool to ensure images and frames meet print-quality standards.


Tips

  1. Recommended DPI: For most print jobs, 300 DPI is standard. Ensure your images and frames meet or exceed this resolution.
  2. Color Consistency: When using CMYK, note that colors may differ slightly from on-screen previews.
  3. Bleed Setup: If your printer requires a bleed, confirm the exact measurement specifications with your print provider.
  4. Downsampling: Keep an eye on image clarity if you significantly reduce the DPI to minimize file size.

plugins.name: ÁîªÊùøjsonÂØºÂá∫(‰∏ì‰∏öÁâà) Export Frame JSON Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin is designed to help users export detailed JSON data of selected nodes, including auto layout information, Frame nesting relationships, text properties, and more. With this plugin, users can easily retrieve structured data from design elements, facilitating data analysis, secondary development, or documentation.


ÂäüËÉΩ

  1. Export complete JSON data of selected nodes, including properties like type, name, size, position, fills, strokes, and more.
  2. Support exporting text content, font name, font size, and other properties of text nodes.
  3. Support nested export of nodes such as Frame, Group, Component, and Instance, preserving the full hierarchical structure.
  4. Complete export of auto layout information, including layout mode, primary and secondary axis alignment, padding, and spacing.
  5. Safely serialized JSON data export ensures compatibility and completeness.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select one or more nodes from which you want to export data.
  2. Click the export button in the plugin, and the plugin will automatically extract all relevant information from the selected nodes and generate JSON data.
  3. The exported JSON data will be displayed in the plugin interface, allowing users to copy or download it for further use.


Notes

  1. This plugin currently supports exporting properties of common node types such as Frame.
  2. Ensure that the selected node types are supported by the plugin; otherwise, related data might not be exportable.
  3. If errors occur during the export process, check whether the nodes contain excessive nesting or complex properties. Simplify the structure if needed and try again.

plugins.name: WEMS for Figma
plugins.description:
WEMS is a powerful platform that transforms your Figma prototypes into fully functional websites or mobile app view in just a few clicks. Designed for modern creators and product teams, WEMS allows you to:


  1. Convert Figma designs into responsive websites or mobile app view
  2. Optimize pages with built-in SEO tools for website
  3. Add translations for multilingual support
  4. Integrate Lottie and Rive animations
  5. Embed MP4 or other embeddable videos (Youtube, Facebook, Vimeo, Twitch etc.)
  6. Support forms with inputs and data send to endpoint
  7. Integrate payment forms or buttons with own products
  8. Connect a custom domain
  9. Run A/B tests to experiment and improve
  10. Track performance with built-in analytics


With WEMS, you can go from design to deployment in record time ‚Äî no coding required

plugins.name: Fastr Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin can convert a Figma file into a Fastr compatible format. This will generate a .zip file that you can import into Fastr Frontend platform. One quick import is all it takes to transform your Figma files into fully interactive experiences‚Äîbrand components, fonts, and layouts intact. Get ready to edit, animate, and publish designs faster than ever before.


How to use the plug-in

If you have any issues when using the plugin, we recommend visiting our community article, which has a full guide and FAQs. For more information about the Fastr Frontend platform, please visit our website.


Reporting Issues

For any questions, please email support@getfastr.com and our team can assist further


License

Penpot and the Penpot exporter plugin are Kaleidos‚Äô open source projects.

plugins.name: Color Combo
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin enables direct testing of color combinations in your design file. This allows the timeless color harmonies of Wada Sanz≈ç to be integrated into modern digital design processes without intermediate steps.


Steps

  1. Open the Color Combo plugin
  2. Select two color styles from the dropdown (or add new ones)
  3. Apply these color styles to your design elements (frames, text, etc.)
  4. Choose a color combination: Click any combination preview, or hit Random for instant variety Toggle Muted colors for subtle palettes

plugins.name: Typographica
plugins.description:
Typographica helps you quickly create beautiful and balanced font combinations for any project ‚Äî from corporate dashboards to creative websites.


The plugin analyzes your chosen primary font, project style, and font metrics to generate harmonious font pairs automatically.


What does Typographica do?


  1. Generates Primary + Secondary + Accent font combinations
  2. Takes into account your project style (7 styles: business, corporate, modern, elegant, fun, personal, minimalist)
  3. Analyzes font metrics (x-height, glyph width, weight, stylistic characteristics)
  4. Automatically filters out fonts that do not fit the selected style
  5. Lets you save combinations as Figma text styles and variables
  6. Optionally adds smart descriptions to generated styles
  7. Supports manual swapping of secondary and accent fonts
  8. Works with any available fonts ‚Äî Google Fonts, local fonts, and Figma-supported fonts


Who is it for?


  1. Product designers ‚Äî to quickly build solid typography systems
  2. UX/UI designers ‚Äî to improve readability and visual rhythm
  3. Brand designers ‚Äî to find well-balanced and creative font pairs
  4. Beginners ‚Äî to get guidance on what fonts work well together
  5. Experienced designers ‚Äî to save time and explore unexpected combinations


How does it work?


  1. Choose your project style
  2. Select a Primary Font
  3. Click Change Pairs
  4. Browse the generated font pairs and accent options
  5. Save styles or variables in one click
  6. Tweak and refine as needed


Why use Typographica?


Save time ‚Äî no more manual font pairing

Get better quality ‚Äî pairs are based on font metrics and style fit, not guesswork

Flexible ‚Äî works for classic and modern designs alike

Customizable ‚Äî easy to adjust pairs or generate new ones on the fly


Styles and Tokens Support


Typographica not only generates font pairs, but also helps you create full-fledged text styles and design tokens in Figma.


You can save your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts as reusable Text Styles and optionally as Variables (Tokens) ‚Äî making your typography consistent across your project and design system.


Style Description Table


Typographica can automatically generate a style description table for your font system ‚Äî right inside Figma.


It creates a clear, editable table summarizing your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts, with suggested usage and style notes.


Perfect for documenting typography choices or sharing with your team and developers.


Typographica is your smart font pairing assistant in Figma. Make your typography cleaner, more beautiful, and more consistent ‚Äî with less effort.

plugins.name: Elemental
plugins.description:
Elemental lets you export images and copy color and shadow values in a single click‚Äîno need to set a layer to export, or break a color style to see the hex value. Elemental is built for those quick one-off moments when a developer needs an asset or another app is asking for your primary brand color.


What it does:

  1. Export one or more layers as images in your desired file type and size
  2. Copy the fill color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  3. Copy the stroke color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  4. Copy a layer's shadows in css format


How it works:

  1. Keep your Elemental panel handy
  2. Select a layer
  3. Click your desired export or copy button
plugins.tagline: Snag basic assets in a flash

This plugin allows you to bulk replace and export text layers in Figma using CSV files‚Äîperfect for efficient content updates and translation workflows.

Highly useful for localization, bulk edits, or working with external editors.


[Key Features]

‚ë†Bulk Replace Text

Simply upload a CSV file where column A = target text and column B = replacement text. The plugin will find and replace matching text layers in your Figma file.


‚ë°Export Text

Export text content from selected frames or layers into a CSV file. Ideal for translation or review processes.


[How to Use]

Open the plugin and go to the ‚ÄúReplace‚Äù tab to upload your CSV and execute replacement.

Use the ‚ÄúExport‚Äù tab to download the text from selected layers as a CSV file.

When a frame is selected, all text layers within that frame will be exported together as a CSV file.

plugins.name: datify
plugins.description:
Quickly update or increment dates across selected frames or text layers. It's perfect for tables, planners, and any layout where dates need to be updated regularly.


  1. Set a start date and automatically increment dates within each frame or across multiple frames
  2. Auto-detect the existing date values across selected frames
  3. Retain the original date format or choose from a list of supported formats
  4. Skip hidden layers
  5. Choose whether to increment dates continuously across all selected frames or restart within each frame
  6. Set the increment to 0 to update all date values to the same date
  7. Enter a minus sign (‚Äì) before the number to decrement the dates instead.


üìÖ Supported date formats:

  1. MMM D (Jan 31)
  2. D MMM YYYY (31 Jan 2025)
  3. D MMMM YYYY (31 January 2025)
  4. MMMM D, YYYY (January 31, 2025)
  5. YYYY-MM-DD (2025-01-31)
  6. DD/MM/YYYY (31/01/2025)
  7. DD-MM-YYYY (31-01-2025)
  8. D/M/YYYY (5/6/2025)
  9. M/D/YY (1/31/25)
  10. YYYY/MM/DD (2025/01/31)
  11. MMMM YYYY (January 2025)
  12. D MMM YY (31 Jan 25)
  13. D.M.YYYY (31.01.2025)
  14. YYYY. M. D (2025. 1. 31)
plugins.tagline: A quick way to update and format dates in your designs

Variables 2 Table is a Figma plugin that turns all your variables‚Äîincluding numbers, colors, strings, and booleans‚Äîinto a well-structured table directly on the canvas.

plugins.name: Lingo
plugins.description:
Lingo helps designers and design teams scale products across multiple markets faster by streamlining localization. Effortlessly translate your designs into multiple languages ‚Äî we handle conversion so you can focus on adaptation.


How to use:


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select entire frame/specific section with content to be translated
  3. Select preferred language and translate.


Use cases:


Lingo will be useful for you or you team if you:


  1. Operate in multiple markets ‚Äì Whether you're launching globally or scaling your existing products across regions, Lingo ensures seamless translation and localization.
  2. Need fast, high-quality translations ‚Äì Quickly adapt marketing materials, product descriptions, and support docs without sacrificing accuracy.
  3. Work with visual content ‚Äì Effortlessly translate social media graphics, posters, infographics, ads, and blog visuals while preserving design integrity.
  4. Manage multilingual blogs and articles ‚Äì Localize blog posts, newsletters, and landing pages while maintaining SEO optimization.
  5. Run international ad campaigns ‚Äì Adapt ad copy, video subtitles, and CTAs for different audiences with culturally relevant messaging.
  6. Collaborate with global teams ‚Äì Streamline workflows by enabling real-time translation for internal documents, presentations, and training materials.
  7. Support customer experience (CX) ‚Äì Provide multilingual customer service content, FAQs, and chatbots for better engagement.


Lingo helps you break language barriers efficiently, so you can focus on adaptation and growth, not conversion.


We'd love to hear from you!‚ù§Ô∏è

How are you using Lingo? What‚Äôs working well, and what could be even better? Your feedback helps us improve and serve you best‚Äîso don‚Äôt hesitate to share your thoughts, wishes, or even tiny frustrations.


Drop us a note at ajaoabdulsamad2000@gmail.com.

plugins.name: Background Manager
plugins.description:
Background Manager makes it easy to switch your Figma canvas background between light, dark, or any custom color ‚Äî instantly.


Use presets, apply hex values, or pick your own color with a live preview. Includes an optional "close after apply" toggle and resizable window for a smooth, focused workflow.


Built for designers who care about context, mood, and file readability.


  1. Light, Dark, and Custom background modes
  2. Color picker + hex input
  3. Auto-syncs to your current canvas background
  4. "Close after applying" option
  5. Minimal, Figma-native UI
plugins.tagline: Quickly switch or customize your canvas background without breaking flow.

plugins.name: Figma to osu!framework
plugins.description:
A third-party plugin to convert Figma elements to osu!framework code


Supported features:

  1. Basic layout (RelativeSizeAxes, Anchor/Orign, Padding, etc.)
  2. Converting cornerRadius to masking containers
  3. Linear Gradients (Both simple as well as multi-stop gradients work as long as they're horizontal or vertical)
  4. Text (Only one style per text element supported)
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma elements into osu!framework snippets
